meanings.definition: Recommend or authorize the use of (a medicine or treatment)
meanings.sent1: The doctor is prescribing antibiotics for the infection.
meanings.sent2: She is prescribing rest and plenty of fluids for her patient.
meanings.sent3: The teacher is prescribing a daily dose of homework for her students.
meanings.sent4: The chef is prescribing a pinch of salt to enhance the flavor.
meanings.sent5: The coach is prescribing extra practice sessions to improve performance.

meanings.definition: Lay down as a rule or guide
meanings.sent1: The company policy prescribes a strict dress code for employees.
meanings.sent2: The recipe prescribes exact measurements for the ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain prescribes a code of conduct for his crew.
meanings.sent4: The law prescribes penalties for breaking the speed limit.
meanings.sent5: The manual prescribes a step-by-step process for assembly.

meanings.definition: Order or direct (someone) to do something
meanings.sent1: The sergeant is prescribing the soldiers to stand at attention.
meanings.sent2: The principal prescribed the students to maintain silence in the library.
meanings.sent3: The parent prescribed the child to finish their homework before playing.
meanings.sent4: The coach prescribed the team to focus on defense during practice.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor prescribed the employees to complete the task by the end of the day.
